I am a Rehabilitation Sciences PhD student in the University of Texas Medical Branch, and my research interests are palliative care, geriatrics, and aging health. Now I am working with Dr Yong-Fang Kuo on a project which using medicare dataset to evaluate the impact of Annual Wellness Visits on MCI/ADRD patients.
I finished my epidemiology, GCP, and health economic training in London School of Economics, where I obtained my Master of Science Degree, and my academic mentor is Dr Olivier Wouters. I also completed a medical social work practicum in palliative care and clinical shadowing in palliative medicine at West China Medical Center, Sichuan University.
I am deeply committed to social welfare, with a particular focus on the well-being of both people and animals. Over the years, I have dedicated more than 1,200 volunteer hours to organizations including the Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding, the Li Ka Shing Foundation’s National Hospice Care Program, and the 31st Chengdu Universiade. I also remain an active registered volunteer with the Galveston Island Humane Society.




2024 - Present: Rehabilitation Sciences PhD student, the University of Texas Medical Branch, specializing in Palliative medicine and geriatrics
2022-2023: Master of Science, London School of Economics, UK, majoring in Health Policy
2018-2022: Bachelor of Law, Sichuan University, China, majoring in Social Work.
